page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY - BATTISFORD
page.content: Battisford parish has 2 Manors, the Manor of Battisford Hall and the Manor of St. John's. This last Manor was originally the site of a hospital of the Order of St. John of Jerusalem until the Dissolution. It was then sold to the Gresham family, as was the other Manor which had been the property of the Bishop of Norwich. A member of the Gresham family, Sir Thomas, founded the Royal Exchange in London, and the framework of that building was constructed from local wood on the common before being transported to London. Flints from a pit at Battisford were used to cobble Needham Market High Street. The common was enclosed in 1812 and a new road, Battisford Straight Road made through the middle. The Church of St. Mary's is mostly of 14th century work.
